conclusion: Analyze the P-V diagram of the Stirling cycle focusing on the transition from state A to state B.
The image shows a P-V diagram of a Stirling cycle with states A, B, C, and D. Process A→B is isothermal expansion, and C→D is isothermal compression.
During an isothermal expansion, the temperature remains constant, volume increases, and internal energy remains constant. Therefore, the gas absorbs heat.
The gas absorbs heat when moving from state A to state B.
